titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 26. V. Friday— Leonard Hammond. Woodbury, J. L. Edwards, Grundy, Poinsett, Paulding— Van Buren Orphan’s Court Accounts for Dr Huntt’s rent passed. Anthony Rothwell has received my Letter— Post Office, Bank of Washington— Order to Cashier to receive my Dividend on Franklin Insurance Company. At Gales’s Office National Intelligencers of 23. April after dinner at R. Smith’s. Gave me draft for 290:17. and Rect. for 64. Visit to A. K. Parris— Genl. Chandler. Packed up.

27. IV:30. Saturday. Cars from Washington to Baltimore from 6 to 8— T. H. Benton— Stop’d at the relay house for western Railroad to Missouri— Call at R. Gilmor’s— In the Country Cars from Baltimore to Philadelphia— Gunpowder—17 miles Bush river 24. Havre de Grace. Susquehanna 35 miles from Baltimore— 5 Miles further axletree of our loco-motive broke— Sent back for another engine—detained more than 2 hours— Mr Newkirke fellow passenger Go ahead Take Steam boat Robert Morris at Wilmington— Land at ...ew-wharf Philadelphia at 7. Sunset— Lodge at Washington House kept by Captain Jefferies 223. Chesnut Street. Cowperthwait called as I entered the House— Offered to take me to-morrow Morning to Andalusia— Mr N. Biddle there. I accept the invitation— Went and spent the Evening with Judge and Mrs Hopkinson— Walnut Street.

28. V. Sunday— Letter to L. C. Adams— Mr Cowperthwait came with his Son, took me out to Andalusia—came at 1/2 past 8 Summer heat and day— Stop to rest the horses at Frankfort remember our detention there in October 1803— Mr Cowperthwait’s house is about a mile short of Andalusia. He
stop’d at the head of the lane leading to his own house— His son went with me to Andalusia— Found N. Biddle there—alone. Mrs Biddle and the family at Philadelphia— He is building two wings to his house— His grapery 3 fold larger than in July 1836. Chinese Morus Multicaulis— Many thousand slips in Pots. Rohan Potatoes— Horace— Gray— Pope Dr Johnson— Charles Lamb— Ennui— Dinner Tete à Tete. Walk to the Depot 1. Mile Cars of Jersey Rail road— Left Philadelphia at 5. P.M. arrived at the Depot near Andalusia at 6—pass through Bristol, Trenton—Princeton. New Brunswick. Rahway, Bridgeport Elizabethtown—Newark—Jersey City— Ferry at the foot of Cortlandt Street— Astor House in Broadway 10 minutes before 11. P.M— I knew not one of my fellow passengers— My chamber N. 119. and to bed.

Letter to my wife— At Breakfast, met Elisha Whittlesey of Ohio, and Edward Miller arrived this morning from Boston, by Stonington. Says Charles is coming to-morrow— Visits from Joseph Blunt Philip Hone—judge John Davis, and sundry others— Dined at the Astor House—at 5. judge Davis came—we took a Hack and called on Mr Gallatin who is in feeble health— Walk back— At 7— Mr Blunt came— Call on Mr and Mrs De Wint at 50. Warren Street— Mrs De Wint’s daughter 5. Months old Attended with Blunt a Meeting of the New-York Historical Society— Then a small party at Mr Stuyvesant’s their President— Statue of John the Baptist as a boy— St. Agatha by Carlo Dolce 2. Pictures course of Empire by Cole Dr. Hawks Dr Wainwright, Folsom and others— John Jay. Rode up in Omnibus— Walk back— About 11. P.M.

Jubilee of the inauguration of George Washington as first President U.S— At 6 this Morning Charles came in to my chamber from Boston. Revd. Dr Francis Parkman and W. P. Lunt— W. Hastings—Nathan Appleton—Southworth—Dawes andfrom Oberlin seminary in Ohio—for subscriptions recommendations and Books— At 11. A.M. Meeting of the Historical Society at the City Hotel— At Noon short procession to middle Dutch Church—corner of Nassau Street— Prayer by the Pastor— Ode by the Choir— I delivered an Address of 2. hours. Well received Crowded Church— Mr W. Duer—President of the Columbia College accompanied me to my lodgings— I then went with him and Charles to the College— Saw the Library and Portraits of Presidents and Professors— Return to my lodgings— 2 hours repose. at 5 pm— Dinner at the City Hotel of 300 persons—Judge Davis—Morgan Lewis—Coll. Trumbull, Captain Gallagher—Saml. L. Southard—Genl Scott. President Duer ... Hastings—N. Appleton, and many others.— Speeches at the dinner. Left the Hall 11. P.M.
